chapter_title: preliminary
section_title: Short title, commencement and application.
section_desc: This section establishes the name of the Act and extends its jurisdiction to offences committed within India, on Indian ships/aircraft, or by Indian citizens abroad.

chapter_title: preliminary
section_title: Definitions.
section_desc: It provides legal meanings for key terms used throughout the code, such as "act," "counterfeit," "document," "public servant," and "injury".

chapter_title: preliminary
section_title: General explanations.
section_desc: This section clarifies that all definitions are subject to General Exceptions and explains concepts like "acts" including illegal omissions and joint liability.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Punishments.
section_desc: It lists the authorized forms of punishment, including death, imprisonment for life, rigorous/simple imprisonment, forfeiture of property, fine, and community service.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Commutation of sentence.
section_desc: Grants the appropriate Government the power to commute a sentence (e.g., death or life imprisonment) to a lighter one without the offender's consent.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Fractions of terms of punishment.
section_desc: States that for calculating fractions of terms, imprisonment for life is reckoned as equivalent to imprisonment for twenty years.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Sentence may be (in certain cases of imprisonment) wholly or partly rigorous or simple.
section_desc: Gives the Court discretion to decide the nature (rigorous or simple) of imprisonment for offences where both are applicable.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Amount of fine, liability in default of payment of fine, etc.
section_desc: Specifies that fines must not be excessive and outlines imprisonment terms if a fine is not paid.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences.
section_desc: Prevents cumulative punishment for an offence that is made up of parts which are themselves offences.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences, judgment stating that it is doubtful of which.
section_desc: Mandates the lowest punishment when it is certain an offender committed one of several offences but doubtful which specific one.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Solitary confinement.
section_desc: Allows courts to order solitary confinement for a portion of rigorous imprisonment, not exceeding three months total.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Limit of solitary confinement.
section_desc: Restricts solitary confinement to fourteen days at a time and seven days per month for longer sentences.

chapter_title: of punishments
section_title: Enhanced punishment for certain offences after previous conviction.
section_desc: Prescribes life imprisonment or up to ten years for repeat offenders of certain property or coin-related crimes.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act done by a person bound, or by mistake of fact believing himself bound, by law.
section_desc: Protects acts done by someone legally bound to do them, or who believes they are bound due to a factual mistake.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act of Judge when acting judicially.
section_desc: Grants immunity for acts done by a Judge in the exercise of judicial power.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act done pursuant to judgment or order of Court.
section_desc: Protects acts committed in adherence to a court judgment or order, even if the court lacked jurisdiction.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act done by a person justified, or by mistake of fact believing himself justified, by law.
section_desc: Exonerates acts done by a person who is justified by law or believes themselves to be justified by a mistake of fact.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Accident in doing a lawful act.
section_desc: States that an accident happening while doing a lawful act with proper care is not an offence.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act likely to cause harm, but done without criminal intent, and to prevent other harm.
section_desc: Protects acts done in good faith to prevent greater harm, even if they are likely to cause harm.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act of a child under seven years of age.
section_desc: Declares that nothing done by a child under seven years old is an offence.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act of a child above seven and under twelve years of age of immature understanding.
section_desc: Exempts children between seven and twelve if they lack the maturity to understand the consequences of their conduct.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act of a person of unsound mind.
section_desc: Exempts acts committed by a person incapable of knowing the nature of the act due to unsoundness of mind.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will.
section_desc: Protects a person intoxicated against their will who cannot judge the nature of their actions.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Offence requiring a particular intent or knowledge committed by one who is intoxicated.
section_desc: Treats voluntarily intoxicated persons as if they had the same knowledge as a sober person regarding their actions.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act not intended and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, done by consent.
section_desc: States that acts causing harm are not offences if done with the victim's consent and without intent to cause death or grievous hurt.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act not intended to cause death, done by consent in good faith for person's benefit.
section_desc: Covers acts done for a person's benefit (like surgery) with their consent, even if it entails risk.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act done in good faith for benefit of child or person of unsound mind, by, or by consent of guardian.
section_desc: Allows guardians to consent to acts for the benefit of children or persons of unsound mind.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception.
section_desc: Invalidates consent if given under fear of injury, misconception of fact, or by a person unable to understand.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Exclusion of acts which are offences independently of harm caused.
section_desc: Clarifies that consent does not justify acts that are offences regardless of harm to the individual (e.g., miscarriage).

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent.
section_desc: Protects emergency acts done for a person's benefit when they are unable to consent.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Communication made in good faith.
section_desc: Protects communications made for a person's benefit (e.g., a doctor's bad news) even if it causes harm like shock.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act to which a person is compelled by threats.
section_desc: Protects acts done under threat of instant death, except murder and offences against the State.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Act causing slight harm.
section_desc: States that acts causing such slight harm that no ordinary person would complain are not offences.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Things done in private defence.
section_desc: Declares that nothing is an offence which is done in the exercise of the right of private defence.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Right of private defence of body and of property.
section_desc: Affirms the right to defend one's own or another's body and property against certain offences.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Right of private defence against act of a person of unsound mind, etc.
section_desc: Maintains the right of self-defence even if the attacker is legally exempt (e.g., insane or a child).

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Acts against which there is no right of private defence.
section_desc: Restricts self-defence against public servants acting in good faith or when there is time to seek public authority assistance.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: When right of private defence of body extends to causing death.
section_desc: Allows causing death in defense against assaults likely to cause death, grievous hurt, rape, or kidnapping.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death.
section_desc: Allows causing any harm short of death if the offence is not one of those listed in Section 38.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Commencement and continuance of right of private defence of body.
section_desc: Describes that the right begins with reasonable apprehension of danger and lasts as long as the danger continues.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: When right of private defence of property extends to causing death.
section_desc: Permits causing death in defense against robbery, house-breaking by night, or arson of a dwelling.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death.
section_desc: Allows causing harm other than death for property offences not listed in Section 41.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Commencement and continuance of right of private defence of property.
section_desc: Defines the timeline for the right of defense against theft, robbery, criminal trespass, and house-breaking.

chapter_title: general exceptions
section_title: Right of private defence against deadly assault when there is risk of harm to innocent person.
section_desc: Allows taking the risk of harming an innocent person if it's the only way to defend against a deadly assault.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abetment of a thing.
section_desc: Defines abetment as instigating, conspiring, or intentionally aiding a person to do a specific thing.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abettor.
section_desc: Defines an "abettor" as the person who abets an offence, regardless of whether the act is committed.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abetment in India of offences outside India.
section_desc: Punishes a person in India who abets an act abroad that would be an offence if committed in India.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abetment outside India for offence in India.
section_desc: Punishes a person outside India who abets the commission of an offence within India.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Punishment of abetment if act abetted is committed in consequence and where no express provision is made for its punishment.
section_desc: States that if the abetted act is committed, the abettor receives the same punishment as the offender unless otherwise specified.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention from that of abettor.
section_desc: Holds the abettor liable for the punishment of the offence even if the doer had a different intention.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Liability of abettor when one act abetted and different act done.
section_desc: Makes the abettor liable for a different act if it was a probable consequence of the abetment.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment for act abetted and for act done.
section_desc: Makes an abettor liable for both the abetted act and the act done if they constitute distinct offences.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Liability of abettor for an effect caused by act abetted different from that intended by abettor.
section_desc: Holds the abettor liable for an unintended effect if they knew it was likely to be caused by the abetted act.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abettor present when offence is committed.
section_desc: Deems the abettor to have committed the offence themselves if they are present during its commission.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life.
section_desc: Prescribes punishment (up to 7 years) for abetting serious offences even if they are not committed.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment.
section_desc: Prescribes punishment (one-fourth of the term) for abetting imprisonable offences that are not committed.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Abetting commission of offence by public or by more than ten persons.
section_desc: Punishes abetting a large group or the public to commit an offence with up to 3 years imprisonment.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life.
section_desc: Punishes voluntarily concealing a plan to commit a serious offence with imprisonment up to 7 years.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Public servant concealing design to commit offence which it is his duty to prevent.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant who conceals a plan to commit an offence they are duty-bound to prevent.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment.
section_desc: Punishes concealing a plan to commit an imprisonable offence with a fraction of the offence's term.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Criminal conspiracy.
section_desc: Defines conspiracy as an agreement between two or more to do an illegal act and prescribes punishment based on the offence planned.

chapter_title: of abetment, criminal conspiracy and attempt
section_title: Punishment for attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment.
section_desc: Punishes attempts to commit offences with up to one-half of the imprisonment provided for the offence itself.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Rape.
section_desc: Defines rape as specific acts of sexual penetration or manipulation without consent or under coercive circumstances.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Punishment for rape.
section_desc: Prescribes rigorous imprisonment of not less than ten years to life, plus a fine, for the offence of rape.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Punishment for rape in certain cases.
section_desc: Mandates rigorous imprisonment of twenty years to life for rape of a woman under sixteen or twelve years of age.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Punishment for causing death or resulting in persistent vegetative state of victim.
section_desc: Prescribes rigorous imprisonment of twenty years to life or death if the rape causes death or a vegetative state.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation.
section_desc: Punishes a husband having non-consensual sex with his wife during legal separation with 2 to 7 years in prison.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Sexual intercourse by a person in authority.
section_desc: Punishes persons in authority (e.g., public servants, jail staff) who induce sex with women in their custody.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Sexual intercourse by employing deceitful means, etc.
section_desc: Criminalizes sexual intercourse obtained by false promises of marriage or employment.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Gang rape.
section_desc: Punishes group rape with imprisonment of not less than twenty years to life; death penalty possible if victim is under 18.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Punishment for repeat offenders.
section_desc: Mandates life imprisonment or death for persons previously convicted of rape offences.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Disclosure of identity of victim of certain offences, etc.
section_desc: Punishes the printing or publishing of the name or identity of victims of sexual offences.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Printing or publishing any matter relating to Court proceedings without permission.
section_desc: Prohibits publishing court proceedings regarding sexual offences without permission.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty.
section_desc: Punishes assaulting a woman to outrage her modesty with imprisonment of 1 to 5 years.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Sexual harassment.
section_desc: Defines and punishes acts like unwelcome physical contact, demands for sexual favors, and showing pornography.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe.
section_desc: Punishes assaulting a woman with the intention of disrobing or compelling her to be naked.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Voyeurism.
section_desc: Punishes watching or capturing images of a woman engaging in a private act.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Stalking.
section_desc: Punishes following or contacting a woman despite her disinterest, or monitoring her internet use.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult modesty of a woman.
section_desc: Punishes words or gestures made to be heard or seen by a woman to insult her modesty.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Dowry death.
section_desc: Defines dowry death (death within 7 years of marriage due to dowry demands) and sets punishment of 7 years to life.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Cohabitation caused by man deceitfully inducing belief of lawful marriage.
section_desc: Punishes a man who deceives a woman into believing they are married to cohabit with her.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife.
section_desc: Punishes bigamy with imprisonment up to 7 years.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Marriage ceremony fraudulently gone through without lawful marriage.
section_desc: Punishes performing a marriage ceremony with fraudulent intent knowing it is not valid.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman.
section_desc: Punishes taking or detaining a married woman with intent for her to have illicit intercourse.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty.
section_desc: Punishes a husband or his relatives for subjecting a woman to cruelty (mental or physical harassment).

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Cruelty defined.
section_desc: Defines "cruelty" as conduct likely to drive a woman to suicide or cause grave injury, or harassment for dowry.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage, etc.
section_desc: Punishes kidnapping a woman to force her into marriage or illicit intercourse.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Causing miscarriage.
section_desc: Punishes voluntarily causing a woman to miscarry, unless done in good faith to save her life.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Causing miscarriage without woman's consent.
section_desc: Prescribes life imprisonment or up to 10 years for causing miscarriage without the woman's consent.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage.
section_desc: Punishes acts intended to cause miscarriage that result in the woman's death.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause to die after birth.
section_desc: Punishes acts preventing a child's live birth or causing it to die after birth.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide.
section_desc: Punishes acts amounting to culpable homicide that cause the death of an unborn quick child.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years of age, by parent or person having care of it.
section_desc: Punishes parents or caretakers who abandon a child under twelve years.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body.
section_desc: Punishes secretly disposing of a child's body to conceal its birth.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Hiring, employing or engaging a child to commit an offence.
section_desc: Punishes hiring or using a child to commit a crime with 3 to 10 years imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Procuration of child.
section_desc: Punishes inducing a child to go from any place for the purpose of illicit intercourse.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Kidnapping or abducting child under ten years of age with intent to steal from its person.
section_desc: Punishes kidnapping a child under ten with the intent to steal property from their person.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Selling child for purposes of prostitution, etc.
section_desc: Punishes selling or disposing of a child for prostitution or illicit intercourse.

chapter_title: of offences against woman and child
section_title: Buying child for purposes of prostitution, etc.
section_desc: Punishes buying or obtaining a child for prostitution or illicit intercourse.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Culpable homicide.
section_desc: Defines culpable homicide as causing death with intention or knowledge that the act is likely to cause death.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Murder.
section_desc: Defines murder as culpable homicide with specific intent to cause death or bodily injury sufficient to cause death.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended.
section_desc: Treats killing the wrong person (transferred malice) as if the intended person had been killed.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Punishment for murder.
section_desc: Prescribes death or imprisonment for life for committing murder, including mob lynching.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Punishment for murder by life-convict.
section_desc: Mandates death or life imprisonment for a person already under a life sentence who commits murder.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.
section_desc: Punishes culpable homicide with imprisonment for life or up to 10 years depending on intent.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Causing death by negligence.
section_desc: Punishes causing death by rash or negligent acts (including driving) not amounting to culpable homicide.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Abetment of suicide of child or person of unsound mind.
section_desc: Punishes abetting the suicide of a vulnerable person with death or life imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Abetment of suicide.
section_desc: Punishes abetting the suicide of any person with imprisonment up to 10 years.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Attempt to murder.
section_desc: Punishes acts done with intent to murder that fail; if hurt is caused, life imprisonment applies.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Attempt to commit culpable homicide.
section_desc: Punishes acts done with intent to commit culpable homicide; penalties increase if hurt is caused.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Organised crime.
section_desc: Defines and punishes continuing unlawful activities by crime syndicates, including kidnapping and economic offences.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Petty organised crime.
section_desc: Punishes theft, snatching, and similar acts committed by members of a gang.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Terrorist act.
section_desc: Defines terrorist acts threatening national integrity and prescribes death or life imprisonment for acts causing death.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Hurt.
section_desc: Defines "hurt" as causing bodily pain, disease, or infirmity to any person.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt.
section_desc: Punishes voluntarily causing hurt with imprisonment up to one year or fine.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Grievous hurt.
section_desc: Lists eight specific types of severe injury, including emasculation and blinding, designated as "grievous".

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt.
section_desc: Punishes voluntarily causing grievous hurt with imprisonment up to seven years.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt or grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means.
section_desc: Increases punishment when hurt is caused by instruments like knives, fire, or poison.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt or grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act.
section_desc: Punishes causing hurt to force someone to deliver property or commit an illegal act.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt or grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property.
section_desc: Punishes causing hurt to force a confession or the restoration of property.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt or grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty.
section_desc: Punishes causing hurt to a public servant to prevent them from doing their duty.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt or grievous hurt on provocation.
section_desc: Provides reduced punishment if the hurt was caused under grave and sudden provocation.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence.
section_desc: Punishes administering poison or drugs to facilitate a crime with up to 10 years imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid, etc.
section_desc: Punishes acid attacks causing permanent damage with minimum 10 years to life imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others.
section_desc: Punishes rash or negligent acts that endanger human life or safety.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Wrongful restraint.
section_desc: Punishes obstructing a person from proceeding in a direction they have a right to go.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Wrongful confinement.
section_desc: Punishes restraining a person within certain limits; penalties increase for longer confinement.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Force.
section_desc: Defines "force" as causing motion, change of motion, or cessation of motion to another person.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Criminal force.
section_desc: Defines criminal force as using force without consent to commit an offence or cause injury/fear.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Assault.
section_desc: Defines assault as making a gesture or preparation that causes apprehension of criminal force.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation.
section_desc: Punishes assault or criminal force with up to 3 months imprisonment unless there is grave provocation.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty.
section_desc: Punishes assaulting a public servant to deter them from their duty.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person, otherwise than on grave provocation.
section_desc: Punishes assault intended to dishonour a person (e.g., pulling a veil).

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person.
section_desc: Punishes assault committed while attempting to steal property carried by a person.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to wrongfully confine a person.
section_desc: Punishes assault committed in an attempt to wrongfully confine a person.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation.
section_desc: Prescribes lighter punishment for assault committed under grave and sudden provocation.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Kidnapping.
section_desc: Defines kidnapping from India and from lawful guardianship, punishable by up to 7 years.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Abduction.
section_desc: Defines abduction as compelling or inducing a person to go from any place by force or deceit.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Kidnapping or maiming a child for purposes of begging.
section_desc: Punishes kidnapping or maiming a child for begging purposes with 10 years to life imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder or for ransom, etc.
section_desc: Punishes kidnapping with intent to murder, or for ransom, with death or life imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Importation of girl or boy from foreign country.
section_desc: Punishes importing minors from abroad for illicit intercourse.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement, kidnapped or abducted person.
section_desc: Punishes concealing a person known to have been kidnapped.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Trafficking of person.
section_desc: Criminalizes recruiting or transporting persons by force or fraud for exploitation.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Exploitation of a trafficked person.
section_desc: Punishes engaging a trafficked child or person for sexual exploitation.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Habitual dealing in slaves.
section_desc: Punishes habitual importing, buying, or selling of slaves.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the human body
section_title: Unlawful compulsory labour.
section_desc: Punishes compelling a person to labor against their will.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Waging, or attempting to wage war, or abetting waging of war, against Government of India.
section_desc: Punishes waging, attempting, or abetting war against the Government with death or life imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Conspiracy to commit offences punishable by section 147.
section_desc: Punishes conspiracy to wage war or overawe the government by criminal force.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Collecting arms, etc., with intention of waging war against Government of India.
section_desc: Punishes collecting men or arms to prepare for war against the Government.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Concealing with intent to facilitate design to wage war.
section_desc: Punishes concealing a design to wage war with intent to facilitate it.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Assaulting President, Governor, etc., with intent to compel or restrain exercise of any lawful power.
section_desc: Punishes assaulting high officials to compel or restrain the exercise of their lawful powers.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Act endangering sovereignty, unity and integrity of India.
section_desc: Punishes acts exciting secession, armed rebellion, or subversive activities.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Waging war against Government of any foreign State at peace with Government of India.
section_desc: Punishes waging war against a foreign power that is at peace with India.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Committing depredation on territories of foreign State at peace with Government of India.
section_desc: Punishes plundering or looting territories of a foreign state at peace with India.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Receiving property taken by war or depredation mentioned in sections 153 and 154.
section_desc: Punishes receiving property known to have been taken in war or depredation.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of State or war to escape.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant who voluntarily allows a State prisoner to escape.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Public servant negligently suffering such prisoner to escape.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant whose negligence allows a State prisoner to escape.

chapter_title: of offences against the state
section_title: Aiding escape of, rescuing or harbouring such prisoner.
section_desc: Punishes aiding, rescuing, or harbouring a State prisoner or prisoner of war.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor or airman from his duty.
section_desc: Punishes abetting mutiny or seducing a soldier/sailor/airman from their duty.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof.
section_desc: Punishes abetting mutiny with death or life imprisonment if the mutiny actually occurs.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in execution of his office.
section_desc: Punishes abetting an assault by a soldier on a superior officer.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Abetment of such assault, if assault committed.
section_desc: Prescribes harsher punishment if the abetted assault on a superior officer is actually committed.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Abetment of desertion of soldier, sailor or airman.
section_desc: Punishes abetting the desertion of a soldier, sailor, or airman.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Harbouring deserter.
section_desc: Punishes harbouring a deserter, knowing they have deserted (except for spouses).

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master.
section_desc: Punishes the master of a merchant vessel for negligently allowing a deserter to conceal themselves.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor or airman.
section_desc: Punishes abetting an act of insubordination by a soldier, sailor, or airman.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Persons subject to certain Acts.
section_desc: Clarifies the application of these sections to persons subject to specific military laws.

chapter_title: of offences relating to the army, navy and air force
section_title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman.
section_desc: Punishes wearing the dress of a soldier/sailor/airman with intent to deceive people into believing one belongs to the forces.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Candidate, electoral right defined.
section_desc: Defines "candidate" and "electoral right" for the purpose of election offences.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Bribery.
section_desc: Defines bribery as giving gratification to induce a person to exercise an electoral right.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Undue influence at elections.
section_desc: Defines undue influence as voluntarily interfering with the free exercise of an electoral right.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Personation at elections.
section_desc: Defines personation as voting in another's name or voting twice.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Punishment for bribery.
section_desc: Prescribes imprisonment up to one year or fine for bribery.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Punishment for undue influence or personation at an election.
section_desc: Prescribes imprisonment for undue influence or personation at an election.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: False statement in connection with an election.
section_desc: Punishes making false statements about a candidate's character to affect the election result.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Illegal payments in connection with an election.
section_desc: Punishes unauthorized payments aimed at promoting a candidate's election.

chapter_title: of offences relating to elections
section_title: Failure to keep election accounts.
section_desc: Punishes the failure to maintain accounts of election expenses as required by law.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Counterfeiting coin, Government stamps, currency-notes or bank-notes.
section_desc: Punishes the act of counterfeiting coins, stamps, or currency notes with imprisonment for life or up to 10 years.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Using as genuine, forged or counterfeit coin, Government stamp, currency-notes or bank-notes.
section_desc: Punishes using or trading counterfeit items as if they were genuine.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Possession of forged or counterfeit coin, Government stamp, currency-notes or bank-notes.
section_desc: Punishes the possession of counterfeit currency or stamps with intent to use them.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Making or possessing instruments or materials for forging or counterfeiting coin, Government stamp, currency-notes or bank-notes.
section_desc: Punishes making or possessing machinery or tools for counterfeiting.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Making or using documents resembling currency-notes or bank-notes.
section_desc: Punishes making documents that look like currency notes to deceive people.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp, or removing from document a stamp used for it, with intent to cause loss to Government.
section_desc: Punishes removing writing from a stamp or removing a stamp from a document to cause loss to Government.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Using Government stamp known to have been before used.
section_desc: Punishes reusing a government stamp that has already been used.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Erasure of mark denoting that stamp has been used.
section_desc: Punishes erasing a cancellation mark from a stamp to use it again.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Prohibition of fictitious stamps.
section_desc: Prohibits the creation or possession of fictitious stamps.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Person employed in mint causing coin to be of different weight or composition from that fixed by law.
section_desc: Punishes mint employees who unlawfully alter the weight or composition of coins.

chapter_title: of offences relating to coin, currency-notes, bank-notes, and government stamps
section_title: Unlawfully taking coining instrument from mint.
section_desc: Punishes taking tools or instruments from a mint without lawful authority.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Unlawful assembly.
section_desc: Defines an unlawful assembly as a group of five or more persons with a common illegal object.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object.
section_desc: Makes every member of an unlawful assembly guilty of any offence committed in prosecution of the common object.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Rioting.
section_desc: Defines rioting as the use of force or violence by an unlawful assembly or its members.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot- if rioting be committed; if not committed.
section_desc: Punishes giving provocation knowing it is likely to cause rioting.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Liability of owner, occupier, etc., of land on which an unlawful assembly or riot takes place.
section_desc: Holds landowners liable if they fail to prevent or report an unlawful assembly on their land.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Affray.
section_desc: Defines affray as two or more persons fighting in a public place and disturbing the peace.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
section_desc: Punishes assaulting a public servant who is attempting to suppress a riot.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony.
section_desc: Punishes acts that promote disharmony or enmity between groups on grounds of religion, race, etc.

chapter_title: of offences against the public tranquillity
section_title: Imputations, assertions prejudicial to national integration.
section_desc: Punishes assertions that harm national integration, such as claiming a group should be deprived of citizenship.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury to any person.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant who disobeys the law with intent to cause injury to any person.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Public servant disobeying direction under law.
section_desc: Punishes disobedience of legal directions by public servants.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Punishment for non-treatment of victim.
section_desc: Punishes hospitals or practitioners who refuse legally required treatment to victims.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Public servant framing an incorrect document with intent to cause injury.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant who frames a document incorrectly with intent to cause injury.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant who engages in trade when legally prohibited from doing so.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant buying or bidding for property they are legally restricted from purchasing.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Personating a public servant.
section_desc: Punishes pretending to be a public servant and doing any act in that assumed character.

chapter_title: of offences by or relating to public servants
section_title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent.
section_desc: Punishes wearing the dress or token of a public servant with fraudulent intent.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding.
section_desc: Punishes absconding to avoid being served with a legal summons or notice.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Preventing service of summons or other proceeding, or preventing publication thereof.
section_desc: Punishes preventing the serving or publishing of a summons or proceeding.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Non-attendance in obedience to an order from public servant.
section_desc: Punishes failing to attend at a specified time and place when legally ordered by a public servant.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Non-appearance in response to a proclamation under section 84 of Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023.
section_desc: Punishes failure to appear after a proclamation requiring appearance has been issued.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Omission to produce document or electronic record to public servant by person legally bound to produce it.
section_desc: Punishes the intentional omission to produce a document to a public servant when legally bound.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it.
section_desc: Punishes omitting to give notice or information to a public servant when legally required.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Furnishing false information.
section_desc: Punishes furnishing information known to be false to a public servant.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Refusing oath or affirmation when duly required by public servant to make it.
section_desc: Punishes refusing to take an oath or affirmation when required by a public servant.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Refusing to answer public servant authorised to question.
section_desc: Punishes refusing to answer questions put by a public servant authorized to ask.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Refusing to sign statement.
section_desc: Punishes refusing to sign a statement when required by a public servant.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: False statement on oath or affirmation to public servant or person authorised to administer an oath or affirmation.
section_desc: Punishes making a false statement on oath to a public servant.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: False information, with intent to cause public servant to use his lawful power to injury of another person.
section_desc: Punishes giving false information to make a public servant use their power to injure another person.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Resistance to taking of property by lawful authority of a public servant.
section_desc: Punishes resisting the lawful taking of property by a public servant.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority of public servant.
section_desc: Punishes obstructing a sale of property conducted by lawful authority.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by authority of public servant.
section_desc: Punishes illegal bidding for property offered for sale by public authority.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions.
section_desc: Punishes voluntarily obstructing a public servant in the discharge of their public functions.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Omission to assist public servant when bound by law to give assistance.
section_desc: Punishes omission to give assistance to a public servant when bound by law to do so.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant.
section_desc: Punishes disobedience to an order issued by a public servant that causes obstruction or danger.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Threat of injury to public servant.
section_desc: Punishes threatening a public servant with injury to induce them to do or forbear an act.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant.
section_desc: Punishes threatening a person to prevent them from seeking legal protection.

chapter_title: of contempts of the lawful authority of public servants
section_title: Attempt to commit suicide to compel or restrain exercise of lawful power.
section_desc: Punishes attempting suicide to coerce a public authority.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Giving false evidence.
section_desc: Defines giving false evidence as making a false statement on oath or in a legal provision.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Fabricating false evidence.
section_desc: Punishes creating false circumstances or entries intended to appear in evidence and mislead a judge.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Punishment for false evidence.
section_desc: Prescribes imprisonment up to 7 years for giving false evidence in judicial proceedings.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence.
section_desc: Punishes giving false evidence intending to cause an innocent person to be convicted and executed.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment.
section_desc: Punishes giving false evidence to cause conviction for an offence punishable with imprisonment.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Threatening any person to give false evidence.
section_desc: Punishes threatening someone to force them to give false testimony.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Using evidence known to be false.
section_desc: Punishes using evidence known to be false as if it were genuine.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Issuing or signing false certificate.
section_desc: Punishes issuing a certificate knowing it to be false in a material point.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Using as true a certificate known to be false.
section_desc: Punishes using a false certificate as true.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence.
section_desc: Punishes making a false statement in a declaration receivable as evidence.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Using as true such declaration knowing it to be false.
section_desc: Punishes using a false declaration as true.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender.
section_desc: Punishes destroying evidence or giving false info to screen an offender.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Intentional omission to give information of offence by person bound to inform.
section_desc: Punishes omitting to give information about an offence when bound to do so.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Giving false information respecting an offence committed.
section_desc: Punishes giving false information about a committed offence.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Destruction of document or electronic record to prevent its production as evidence.
section_desc: Punishes destroying a document to prevent it from being used as evidence.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution.
section_desc: Punishes falsely personating another in a civil or criminal proceeding.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution.
section_desc: Punishes removing property to prevent its lawful seizure or forfeiture.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution.
section_desc: Punishes making a fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Fraudulently suffering decree for sum not due.
section_desc: Punishes suffering a court decree for a sum not due to defraud creditors.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Dishonestly making false claim in Court.
section_desc: Punishes making a false claim in court to injure or annoy another.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Fraudulently obtaining decree for sum not due.
section_desc: Punishes obtaining a court decree for a sum not due.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: False charge of offence made with intent to injure.
section_desc: Punishes making a false charge of an offence with intent to injure.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Harbouring offender.
section_desc: Punishes harbouring a person known to have committed an offence.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Taking gift, etc., to screen an offender from punishment.
section_desc: Punishes taking a bribe to conceal an offence or screen an offender.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender.
section_desc: Punishes offering a bribe to screen an offender.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Taking gift to help to recover stolen property, etc.
section_desc: Punishes taking money to recover stolen property without helping to apprehend the thief.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Harbouring offender who has escaped from custody or whose apprehension has been ordered.
section_desc: Punishes harbouring an offender who has escaped custody.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Penalty for harbouring robbers or dacoits.
section_desc: Punishes harbouring groups of robbers or dacoits.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant disobeying law to save someone from punishment.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Public servant framing incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant framing an incorrect record to save someone from punishment.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Public servant in judicial proceeding corruptly making report, etc., contrary to law.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant making a report contrary to law in a judicial proceeding.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Commitment for trial or confinement by person having authority who knows that he is acting contrary to law.
section_desc: Punishes a person in authority who commits someone for trial knowing it is contrary to law.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Intentional omission to apprehend on part of public servant bound to apprehend.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant who intentionally omits to apprehend an offender.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Intentional omission to apprehend on part of public servant bound to apprehend person under sentence or lawfully committed.
section_desc: Punishes omission to apprehend a person under sentence.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Escape from confinement or custody negligently suffered by public servant.
section_desc: Punishes a public servant for negligently allowing a prisoner to escape.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension.
section_desc: Punishes resisting one's own lawful apprehension.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension of another person.
section_desc: Punishes resisting the lawful apprehension of another person.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Omission to apprehend, or sufferance of escape, on part of public servant, in cases not otherwise provided for.
section_desc: Punishes omission to apprehend in cases not otherwise provided for.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension or escape or rescue in cases not otherwise provided for.
section_desc: Punishes resistance to apprehension in cases not otherwise provided for.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Violation of condition of remission of punishment.
section_desc: Punishes violating the conditions under which a sentence was suspended or remitted.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Intentional insult or interruption to public servant sitting in judicial proceeding.
section_desc: Punishes insulting a public servant during a judicial proceeding.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Personation of assessor.
section_desc: Punishes pretending to be an assessor or juror.

chapter_title: of false evidence and offences against public justice
section_title: Failure by person released on bail or bond to appear in Court.
section_desc: Punishes failure to appear in court after being released on bail.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Public nuisance.
section_desc: Defines acts that cause common injury, danger, or annoyance to the public.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life.
section_desc: Punishes negligent acts likely to spread a dangerous disease.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life.
section_desc: Punishes malignant acts done with intent to spread a dangerous disease.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Disobedience to quarantine rule.
section_desc: Punishes disobeying rules made to prevent the spread of infection.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale.
section_desc: Punishes adulterating food or drink intended for sale.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Sale of noxious food or drink.
section_desc: Punishes selling food or drink that is noxious or unfit for consumption.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Adulteration of drugs.
section_desc: Punishes adulterating drugs to lessen efficacy or make them noxious.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Sale of adulterated drugs.
section_desc: Punishes selling adulterated drugs as genuine.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Sale of drug as a different drug or preparation.
section_desc: Punishes selling one drug while pretending it is another.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir.
section_desc: Punishes fouling the water of a public spring or reservoir.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Making atmosphere noxious to health.
section_desc: Punishes acts that make the atmosphere noxious to health.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Rash driving or riding on a public way.
section_desc: Punishes rash or negligent driving on a public way.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Rash navigation of vessel.
section_desc: Punishes rash or negligent navigation of a vessel.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Exhibition of false light, mark or buoy.
section_desc: Punishes exhibiting false lights to mislead navigators.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel.
section_desc: Punishes conveying persons in an unsafe or overloaded vessel.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation.
section_desc: Punishes causing danger or obstruction in a public way.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance.
section_desc: Punishes negligent handling of poisonous substances.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter.
section_desc: Punishes negligent handling of fire or combustible matter.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance.
section_desc: Punishes negligent handling of explosive substances.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery.
section_desc: Punishes negligent management of machinery.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down, repairing or constructing buildings, etc.
section_desc: Punishes negligence in repairing or pulling down buildings.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to animal.
section_desc: Punishes negligence in taking care of animals.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for.
section_desc: Provides punishment for public nuisances not otherwise punishable.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue.
section_desc: Punishes continuing a nuisance after being ordered to stop.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.
section_desc: Punishes the sale or distribution of obscene books or objects.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Sale, etc., of obscene objects to child.
section_desc: Punishes selling obscene objects to a person under eighteen.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Obscene acts and songs.
section_desc: Punishes doing obscene acts or singing obscene songs in public.

chapter_title: of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals
section_title: Keeping lottery office.
section_desc: Punishes keeping an unauthorized lottery office.

chapter_title: of offences relating to religion
section_title: Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult religion of any class.
section_desc: Punishes injuring or defiling a place of worship with intent to insult religion.

chapter_title: of offences relating to religion
section_title: Deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs.
section_desc: Punishes deliberate acts intended to outrage religious feelings by insulting religion.

chapter_title: of offences relating to religion
section_title: Disturbing religious assembly.
section_desc: Punishes voluntarily disturbing a religious assembly.

chapter_title: of offences relating to religion
section_title: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
section_desc: Punishes trespassing on burial grounds to wound feelings.

chapter_title: of offences relating to religion
section_title: Uttering words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings of any person.
section_desc: Punishes uttering words or making sounds to wound religious feelings.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Theft.
section_desc: Defines theft as moving movable property out of possession without consent and prescribes punishment.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Snatching.
section_desc: Defines snatching as forcible or quick seizure of property and prescribes punishment.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Theft in a dwelling house, or means of transportation or place of worship, etc.
section_desc: Punishes theft in a building, vessel, or of idols, with imprisonment up to 7 years.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master.
section_desc: Punishes theft committed by a clerk or servant of their master's property.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Theft after preparation made for causing death, hurt or restraint in order to committing of theft.
section_desc: Punishes theft committed after preparing to cause death, hurt, or restraint.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Extortion.
section_desc: Defines extortion as inducing delivery of property by putting a person in fear of injury.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Robbery.
section_desc: Defines robbery as theft or extortion involving death, hurt, or wrongful restraint (definitions vary based on context).

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dacoity.
section_desc: Defines dacoity as robbery committed by five or more persons conjointly.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Robbery, or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt.
section_desc: Punishes robbery or dacoity accompanied by an attempt to cause death or grievous hurt.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon.
section_desc: Punishes attempting robbery or dacoity while armed with a deadly weapon.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Punishment for belonging to gang of robbers, etc.
section_desc: Punishes belonging to a gang associated for habitually committing theft or robbery.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dishonest misappropriation of property.
section_desc: Punishes dishonest misappropriation of movable property for one's own use.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person at the time of his death.
section_desc: Punishes misappropriating property from a deceased person before it is legally distributed.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Criminal breach of trust.
section_desc: Punishes a person entrusted with property who dishonestly uses or disposes of it.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Stolen property.
section_desc: Defines stolen property and punishes receiving it knowing it to be stolen.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Cheating.
section_desc: Defines cheating as deceiving a person to deliver property or do an act causing harm.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Cheating by personation.
section_desc: Punishes cheating by pretending to be another person.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors.
section_desc: Punishes removing property to prevent its distribution among creditors.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dishonestly or fraudulently preventing debt being available for creditors.
section_desc: Punishes fraudulently preventing a debt from being available to creditors.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing false statement of consideration.
section_desc: Punishes executing a transfer deed containing false statements of consideration.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property.
section_desc: Punishes concealing or removing property to defraud others.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Mischief.
section_desc: Defines mischief as causing destruction or damage to property affecting its value.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Mischief by killing or maiming animal.
section_desc: Punishes mischief by killing or maiming any animal.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Mischief by injury, inundation, fire or explosive substance, etc.
section_desc: Punishes mischief committed by fire or explosive substance intending damage.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a rail, aircraft, decked vessel or one of twenty tons burden.
section_desc: Punishes mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a vessel.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Punishment for intentionally running vessel aground or ashore with intent to commit theft, etc.
section_desc: Punishes intentionally running a vessel aground to commit theft.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Criminal trespass and house-trespass.
section_desc: Defines criminal trespass as entering property to commit an offence or intimidate.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: House-trespass and house-breaking.
section_desc: Defines house-trespass as criminal trespass in a human dwelling or place of worship.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Punishment for house-trespass or house-breaking.
section_desc: Prescribes punishment for house-trespass and house-breaking.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: House-trespass in order to commit offence.
section_desc: Punishes house-trespass committed in order to commit an offence punishable with death/life imprisonment.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint.
section_desc: Punishes house-trespass after making preparation for causing hurt or restraint.

chapter_title: of offences against property
section_title: Dishonestly breaking open receptacle containing property.
section_desc: Punishes breaking open a closed receptacle containing property.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Making a false document.
section_desc: Defines the act of making a false document (forgery core definition).

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Forgery.
section_desc: Defines forgery as making a false document with intent to cause damage or deceit.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Forgery of record of Court or of public register, etc.
section_desc: Punishes forgery of a court record or public register.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Forgery of valuable security, will, etc.
section_desc: Punishes forgery of a valuable security, will, or authority to adopt.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Having possession of document described in section 337 or section 338, knowing it to be forged and intending to use it as genuine.
section_desc: Punishes possession of a forged document knowing it to be forged.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Forged document or electronic record and using it as genuine.
section_desc: Defines forged document and punishes using it as genuine.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery punishable under section 338.
section_desc: Punishes making or possessing a counterfeit seal or plate for forgery.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents described in section 338, or possessing counterfeit marked material.
section_desc: Punishes counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Fraudulent cancellation, destruction, etc., of will, authority to adopt, or valuable security.
section_desc: Punishes fraudulent destruction or cancellation of a will or valuable security.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Falsification of accounts.
section_desc: Punishes a clerk or servant who wilfully falsifies accounts to defraud.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Property mark.
section_desc: Defines property mark and punishes using a false property mark.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Tampering with property mark with intent to cause injury.
section_desc: Punishes tampering with a property mark to cause injury.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Counterfeiting a property mark.
section_desc: Punishes counterfeiting a property mark used by another.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Making or possession of any instrument for counterfeiting a property mark.
section_desc: Punishes possessing tools for counterfeiting property marks.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Selling goods marked with a counterfeit property mark.
section_desc: Punishes selling goods knowing they bear a counterfeit property mark.

chapter_title: of offences relating to documents and to property marks
section_title: Making a false mark upon any receptacle containing goods.
section_desc: Punishes making a false mark on a package to deceive about its contents.

chapter_title: of criminal intimidation, insult, annoyance, defamation, etc
section_title: Criminal intimidation.
section_desc: Punishes threatening a person with injury to their person, reputation, or property.

chapter_title: of criminal intimidation, insult, annoyance, defamation, etc
section_title: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of peace.
section_desc: Punishes intentional insult likely to provoke a breach of the peace.

chapter_title: of criminal intimidation, insult, annoyance, defamation, etc
section_title: Statements conducing to public mischief.
section_desc: Punishes circulating rumors or reports aiming to cause mutiny or public alarm.

chapter_title: of criminal intimidation, insult, annoyance, defamation, etc
section_title: Act caused by inducing person to believe that he will be rendered an object of Divine displeasure.
section_desc: Punishes inducing a person to do something by making them believe they will face Divine displeasure.

chapter_title: of criminal intimidation, insult, annoyance, defamation, etc
section_title: Misconduct in public by a drunken person.
section_desc: Punishes a drunken person for causing annoyance in a public place.

chapter_title: of criminal intimidation, insult, annoyance, defamation, etc
section_title: Defamation.
section_desc: Defines defamation as making an imputation to harm a person's reputation and prescribes punishment.

chapter_title: of criminal intimidation, insult, annoyance, defamation, etc
section_title: Breach of contract to attend on and supply wants of helpless person.
section_desc: Punishes omitting to supply wants to a helpless person one is bound by contract to care for.

chapter_title: repeal and savings
section_title: Repeal and savings.
section_desc: Repeals the Indian Penal Code, 1860, while saving acts/rights/penalties incurred under it.
